@dksunny gog.com version is 1.95GB in size. And this truely is great work from Reloaded. 
Managing to release a game that got a DRM free version. Pirating this is pathetic.

@Kleppemeister: This is the GoG.com version, it was just packed by Reloaded.  The main game is 1.95GB but inside the .iso are also some extras in .rar archives (Dev diary videos, wallpapers, avatars and the Night Spring videos) that is why the 2.58 GiB size.

There is no crack in this release, since it's the GoG.com version just install and play.

My spec: Win 7 64, 8GB, GTX 560 and PII X6 1090T

I mildly enjoyed the original alan wake, most redeeming factor was the graphics. The story was so-so and good concept of incorporating light usage.

however for this stand alone game, it is mediocre. i didn't care two much about the story. The whole game practically takes place in three environments and in three acts. each act goes through the same 3 environments and same places. (no wonder the game is so small at 2.6gb).  the game is relatively short too (about 4-6hours), beat it in two night's of gameplay.  

There is also an Action mode where you just fight the enemies (the Taken) but ive already uninstalled the game after i beat it.

I did like using the nail gun though and the controls seem to be respond quicker compared to the first game.
